instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2532 No boot
threads.message:
Hi,
board clean without liquid, probably wifi cable cause problem. don't boot but green light.
PPBUS_G3H=12,5V
R7022=10ohm
R7021=10
R7051=10
R7052=10
SMC_PM_G2_EN=3,4V
PP3V3_S5=3,4V
PP5V_S5_REG=0V is it normal? if not U7201 dead?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2532 No boot
threads.message: Voltage on C7771? If something like 0.3V then replace C7771. Also make sure to use a REAL 85W charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2532 No boot
threads.message:
i have on C7771=0,37V, i replace it and now i have 1,105, but no boot again.
sorry i use now a real 85W for the measure.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2532 No boot
threads.message: Did you short the power on pads? No auto power on. To eliminate a fake charger connect a battery and let it charge for a while.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2532 No boot
threads.message:
Ok it's ok for me, she is alive :D. sorry i forgot to post the result.
thanks
